dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: (We played our hearts out. There's no way we didn't get in!)

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: ...What was that supposed to be?

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Um. Music?

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: Oh, it was music, of course, how could I have been so stupid--

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: Of course it's music. What genre? What are you even going for here?

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Uhh, it's a blend of different rock genres with influence from both classical music and traditional songs from our respective cultures.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: So you made it up.

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: No??? I literally just said it's based on--

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: Look, I'm gonna let you in on a little secret. People want something pleasant. They want familiarity. This weird experimental stuff you're doing, the melodies that feel like they're clawing their way into your ears...

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: ...Well, it sounds like something straight out of the old Dissonant Zones. And CC's about getting rid of Dissonance, not making more of it.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: You might not like it, but nobody wants the type of music you're making except other little freaks like you.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: ...Wait, did G tell me to stop calling the talent freaks? Ah, whatever, it's probably fine.

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: ...I-if I may.

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: We use chord progressions similar to musicians who are popular in... the, er, former Dissonant Zones. So to, for example, another Naga, many of our songs might be both pleasant and familiar.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: ...So, what you're saying is, you only like it if you grew up with it.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: Or you're telling me my tastes just aren't exotic enough.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: You know what, maybe that's the angle you could go with! Exotic.

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Absolutely not.

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: Well, doesn't matter to me. Not like you're signing with us. Oh, and speaking of...

dialogue.name: Rockie M
dialogue.text: ...You all need to get out of my office. I've got someone coming in whose music actually has an audience.

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: WELL THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR TIME SIR WE'LL BE GOING NOW!

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: W-WITH NO FUSS WHATSOEVER! RIGHT GUYS???

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: ...right...?

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: ...Yeah. Fine.
Outside Absolute Records HQ...

dialogue.name: Niimi
dialogue.text: ......<color=#FF0097>[!&#$%!]</color> that guy.

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: Niimi! Can you at least say that when we're further from the building?!

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: No, they're right! [!&#$%!] that guy!

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Our music sounds like it comes from the Dissonant Zones??? Maybe that's the POINT, DUMBASS! Maybe we don't WANT to be like every other Cleansed Zone-approved HACK!

dialogue.name: Niimi
dialogue.text: He hasn't made any music in years... Why does he get to make the decision anyway...?

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: Guys, please, I'm angry too, but we just have to try agai-

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: We just have to try again!

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Even if we have to FORCE them to listen!

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: YEA- Wait what?

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: They can't technically stop us if we just play the tour anyway! We'll follow the Concert of Cleansing and do our OWN shows, as long as it takes for them to give us our rightful spot!

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: Won't the police shut us down? Or at least the bylaw officers?

dialogue.name: Niimi
dialogue.text: Not if we run fast enough.

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: That's not... *sigh*

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Look, Sonu. We started making music because we wanted to change the world, remember?

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: ...Yeah. I remember.

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: The Concert of Cleansing is the biggest stage in the world. If we want to make an impression... Well, where else would we go, Sonu? We HAVE to be there!

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: But we WON'T be! We didn't get accepted, Fayruz.

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: ...what about Asmi Adani?

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: W-wait, you can't--

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: She didn't wait to be accepted, did she?

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: *sigh* ...No. She played no matter what.

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Come on, Sonu. You know we can't wait another year.

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: <size=30>If we do, I might have to get a second job...</size>

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: ...Can we at least get a permit?

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: We can try!

dialogue.name: Sonu
dialogue.text: ......Okay. I'm in.

dialogue.name: Niimi
dialogue.text: Hell yes brotherrrrrr

dialogue.name: Fayruz
dialogue.text: Let's pack the van! A.C.E is going on tour!
